items.sentence: Do you have a pencil sharpener? I need to sharpen my pencil.
Tom is a thirteen-year-old boy who lives in my neighborhood.
I have two sons. One is in Tokyo and the other is in Nagoya.

I'm still going to do it, no matter how much it bothers you.
I went to the book store and bought a very interesting book.
The team needs to define the scope of the project by Monday.
Recently there has been a lot of talk about remote teaching.
Tom doesn't get along well with the other boys in his class.
You can choose a path, but not the people you'll meet on it.
Let's not do anything until we've discussed all the options.

Mary isn't as beautiful as her sister, but she is beautiful.

We have a responsibility to do whatever we can to help them.
Tom, Mary, John and Alice all live with their dad in Boston.
You're the only person that I know who doesn't like bananas.

You didn't know that I no longer needed to do that, did you?
Try updating your browser and see if that fixes the problem.
Of all the countries you've visited, which is your favorite?
The only song Tom has ever written was the one he just sang.
Tom and Mary want to spend the rest of their lives together.
Tom told me that he was going to ask you to be his best man.
Tom told me that he was planning to go to Boston in October.
Tom told me that he was planning to go to college in Boston.

Tom told me he would like to go to the zoo with us tomorrow.
I don't think that I'm the only one who's worried about Tom.
I don't think I'd be able to convince Tom to do that for us.

I don't think that anyone really thought that Tom was happy.
I don't think that anybody really thought that Tom was busy.
Tom told me that he thought that you could probably do that.

Tom told Mary that he'd finished the work three days before.
